00037 #define XNARCH_DEFAULT_TICK     1000000 /* ns, i.e. 1ms */
00038 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK        (1000000000UL/HZ)

00040 #define XNARCH_THREAD_STACKSZ   4096

00042 #define xnarch_stack_size(tcb)  ((tcb)->stacksize)
00043 #define xnarch_user_task(tcb)   ((tcb)->user_task)
00044 #define xnarch_user_pid(tcb)    ((tcb)->user_task->pid)

00046 struct xnthread;
00047 struct task_struct;
00048 
00049 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00050 
00051     /* Kernel mode side */
00052 
00053 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00054     /* We only care for basic FPU handling in kernel-space; Altivec
00055        and SPE are not available to kernel-based nucleus threads. */
00056     rthal_fpenv_t fpuenv  __attribute__ ((aligned (16)));
00057     rthal_fpenv_t *fpup;        /* Pointer to the FPU backup area */
00058     struct task_struct *user_fpu_owner;
00059     /* Pointer the the FPU owner in userspace:
00060        - NULL for RT K threads,
00061        - last_task_used_math for Linux US threads (only current or NULL when MP)
00062        - current for RT US threads.
00063     */
00064 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     ((tcb)->fpup)
00065 #else /* !CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00066 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     NULL
00067 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00068 
00069     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00070     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00071     unsigned long ksp;          /* Saved KSP for kernel-based threads */
00072     unsigned long *kspp;        /* Pointer to saved KSP (&ksp or &user->thread.ksp) */
00073 
00074     /* User mode side */
00075     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00076     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00077 
00078     /* Init block */
00079     struct xnthread *self;
00080     int imask;
00081     const char *name;
00082     void (*entry)(void *cookie);
00083     void *cookie;
00084 
00085 } xnarchtcb_t;
00086 
00087 typedef struct xnarch_fltinfo {
00088 
00089     unsigned exception;
00090     struct pt_regs *regs;
00091 
00092 } xnarch_fltinfo_t;
00093 
00094 #define xnarch_fault_trap(fi)   ((unsigned int)(fi)->regs->trap)
00095 #define xnarch_fault_code(fi)   ((fi)->regs->dar)
00096 #define xnarch_fault_pc(fi)     ((fi)->regs->nip)
00097 #define xnarch_fault_pc(fi)     ((fi)->regs->nip)
00098 /* FIXME: FPU faults ignored by the nanokernel on PPC. */
00099 #define xnarch_fault_fpu_p(fi)  (0)
00100 /* The following predicates are only usable over a regular Linux stack
00101    context. */
00102 #ifdef CONFIG_ADEOS_CORE
00103 #define xnarch_fault_pf_p(fi)   ((fi)->exception == ADEOS_ACCESS_TRAP)
00104 #define xnarch_fault_bp_p(fi)   ((current->ptrace & PT_PTRACED) && \
00105                                  ((fi)->exception == ADEOS_IABR_TRAP || \
00106                                   (fi)->exception == ADEOS_SSTEP_TRAP || \
00107                                   (fi)->exception == ADEOS_DEBUG_TRAP))
00108 #else /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_CORE */
00109 #define xnarch_fault_pf_p(fi)   ((fi)->exception == IPIPE_TRAP_ACCESS)
00110 #define xnarch_fault_bp_p(fi)   ((current->ptrace & PT_PTRACED) && \
00111                                  ((fi)->exception == IPIPE_TRAP_IABR || \
00112                                   (fi)->exception == IPIPE_TRAP_SSTEP || \
00113                                   (fi)->exception == IPIPE_TRAP_DEBUG))
00114 #endif /* CONFIG_ADEOS_CORE */
00115 
00116 #define xnarch_fault_notify(fi) (!xnarch_fault_bp_p(fi))

00122 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes)
00123 
00124 {
00125 #if 0   /* FIXME: likely on-demand mapping bug here */
00126     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00127         return vmalloc(bytes);
00128 #endif
00129 
00130     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_KERNEL);
00131 }
00132 
00133 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes)
00134 
00135 {
00136 #if 0   /* FIXME: likely on-demand mapping bug here */
00137     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00138         vfree(chunk);
00139     else
00140 #endif
00141         kfree(chunk);
00142 }

00144 static inline void xnarch_relay_tick (void)
00145 
00146 {
00147     rthal_irq_host_pend(RTHAL_TIMER_IRQ);

00156 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long ns,
00157                                       void (*tickhandler)(void))

00162 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00163 
00164 {
00165     rthal_declare_cpuid;
00166 
00167     rthal_load_cpuid();
00168 
00169     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00170        and always inside a critical section. */
00171     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00172     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00173     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_current_host_task(cpuid);
00174 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00175     rootcb->user_fpu_owner = rthal_get_fpu_owner(rootcb->user_task);
00176     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00177     rootcb->fpup = (rootcb->user_fpu_owner
00178                     ? (rthal_fpenv_t *)&rootcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.fpr[0]
00179                     : NULL);
00180 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00181 }
00182 
00183 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00184     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00185 }
00186 
00187 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00188                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00189 {
00190     struct task_struct *prev = out_tcb->active_task;
00191     struct task_struct *next = in_tcb->user_task;
00192 
00193     in_tcb->active_task = next ?: prev;
00194 
00195     if (next && next != prev) /* Switch to new user-space thread? */
00196         {
00197         struct mm_struct *mm = next->active_mm;
00198 
00199         /* Switch the mm context.*/
00200 
00201 #ifdef CONFIG_ALTIVEC
00202         /* Don't rely on FTR fixups --
00203            they don't work properly in our context. */
00204         if (cur_cpu_spec[0]->cpu_features & CPU_FTR_ALTIVEC) {
00205             asm volatile (
00206                 "dssall;\n"
00207 #ifndef CONFIG_POWER4
00208                 "sync;\n"
00209 #endif
00210                 : : );
00211         }
00212 #endif /* CONFIG_ALTIVEC */
00213 
00214         next->thread.pgdir = mm->pgd;
00215         get_mmu_context(mm);
00216         set_context(mm->context,mm->pgd);
00217 
00218         /* _switch expects a valid "current" (r2) for storing
00219          * ALTIVEC and SPE state. */
00220         current = prev;
00221         _switch(&prev->thread, &next->thread);
00222 
00223         barrier();
00224         }
00225     else
00226         /* Kernel-to-kernel context switch. */
00227         rthal_switch_context(out_tcb->kspp,in_tcb->kspp);
00228 }
00229 
00230 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00231                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb)
00232 {
00233     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00234 }
00235 
00236 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb)
00237 
00238 {
00239     /* Empty */
00240 }

00242 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00243                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00244                                          const char *name)
00245 {
00246     tcb->user_task = current;
00247     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00248     tcb->ksp = 0;
00249     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00250 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00251     tcb->user_fpu_owner = NULL;
00252     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00253 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00254     tcb->entry = NULL;
00255     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00256     tcb->self = thread;
00257     tcb->imask = 0;
00258     tcb->name = name;
00259 }
00260 
00261 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_trampoline (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00262 
00263 {
00264     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!tcb->imask);
00265     xnpod_welcome_thread(tcb->self);
00266     tcb->entry(tcb->cookie);
00267     xnpod_delete_thread(tcb->self);
00268 }
00269 
00270 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00271                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00272                                        void *cookie,
00273                                        int imask,
00274                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00275                                        char *name)
00276 {
00277     unsigned long *ksp, flags;
00278 
00279     rthal_local_irq_flags_hw(flags);
00280 
00281     *tcb->stackbase = 0;
00282     ksp = (unsigned long *)((((unsigned long)tcb->stackbase + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf)
00283                             - RTHAL_SWITCH_FRAME_SIZE);
00284     tcb->ksp = (unsigned long)ksp - STACK_FRAME_OVERHEAD;
00285     ksp[19] = (unsigned long)tcb; /* r3 */
00286     ksp[25] = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_trampoline; /* lr */
00287     ksp[26] = flags & ~(MSR_EE | MSR_FP); /* msr */
00288 
00289     tcb->entry = entry;
00290     tcb->cookie = cookie;
00291     tcb->self = thread;
00292     tcb->imask = imask;
00293     tcb->name = name;
00294 }
00295 
00296 /* No lazy FPU init on PPC. */
00297 #define xnarch_fpu_init_p(task) (1)
00298 
00299 static inline void xnarch_enable_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *current_tcb)
00300 
00301 {
00302 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00303     if(!current_tcb->user_task)
00304         rthal_enable_fpu();
00305 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00306 }
00307 
00308 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00309 
00310 {
00311 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00312     /* Initialize the FPU for an emerging kernel-based RT thread. This
00313        must be run on behalf of the emerging thread. */
00314     memset(&tcb->fpuenv,0,sizeof(tcb->fpuenv));
00315     rthal_init_fpu(&tcb->fpuenv);
00316 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00317 }
00318 
00319 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00320 
00321 {
00322 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00323 
00324     if(tcb->fpup)
00325         {
00326         rthal_save_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00327 
00328         if(tcb->user_fpu_owner && tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs)
00329             tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs->msr &= ~MSR_FP;
00330         }   
00331 
00332 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00333 }
00334 
00335 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00336 
00337 {
00338 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00339 
00340     if(tcb->fpup)
00341         {
00342         rthal_restore_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00343 
00344         if(tcb->user_fpu_owner && tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs)
00345             tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs->msr |= MSR_FP;
00346         }   
00347 
00348     /* FIXME: We restore FPU "as it was" when Xenomai preempted Linux,
00349        whereas we could be much lazier. */
00350     if(tcb->user_task)
00351         rthal_disable_fpu();
00352 
00353 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00354 }
00355 
00356 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */
00357 
00358 #ifdef XENO_THREAD_MODULE
00359 
00360 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00361 
00362     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00363     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00364     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00365 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00366     tcb->user_fpu_owner = NULL;
00367     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00368 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00369     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00370 }
00371 
00372 #define xnarch_alloc_stack(tcb,stacksize) \
00373 ({ \
00374     int __err; \
00375     (tcb)->stacksize = stacksize; \
00376     if (stacksize == 0) { \
00377         (tcb)->stackbase = NULL; \
00378         __err = 0; \
00379     } else { \
00380         (tcb)->stackbase = xnmalloc(stacksize); \
00381         __err = (tcb)->stackbase ? 0 : -ENOMEM; \
00382     } \
00383     __err; \
00384 })
00385 
00386 #define xnarch_free_stack(tcb) \
00387 do { \
00388       if ((tcb)->stackbase) \
00389           xnfree((tcb)->stackbase); \
00390 } while(0)
00391 
00392 #endif /* XENO_THREAD_MODULE */
00393 
00394 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00395 
00396 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00397                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00398                                            const char *name)
00399 {
00400     struct task_struct *task = current;
00401 
00402     tcb->user_task = task;
00403     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00404     tcb->ksp = 0;
00405     tcb->kspp = &task->thread.ksp;
00406 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00407     tcb->user_fpu_owner = task;
00408     tcb->fpup = (rthal_fpenv_t *)&task->thread.fpr[0];
00409 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00410     tcb->entry = NULL;
00411     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00412     tcb->self = thread;
00413     tcb->imask = 0;
00414     tcb->name = name;
00415 }

00417 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00418 
00419 {
00420     unsigned irq;
00421 
00422     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00423         rthal_virtualize_irq(rthal_current_domain,
00424                              irq,
00425                              handler,
00426                              NULL,
00427                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00428 
00429     /* On this arch, the decrementer trap is not an external IRQ but
00430        it is instead mapped to a virtual IRQ, so we must grab it
00431        individually. */
00432 
00433     rthal_virtualize_irq(rthal_current_domain,
00434                          RTHAL_TIMER_IRQ,
00435                          handler,
00436                          NULL,
00437                          IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00438 }
00439 
00440 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (rthal_pipeline_stage_t *ipd, int cpuid)
00441 
00442 {
00443     unsigned irq;
00444 
00445     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00446         {
00447         switch (irq)
00448             {
00449 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00450             case RTHAL_CRITICAL_IPI:
00451 
00452                 /* Never lock out this one. */
00453                 continue;
00454 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00455 
00456             default:
00457 
00458                 rthal_lock_irq(ipd,cpuid,irq);
00459             }
00460         }
00461 
00462     rthal_lock_irq(ipd,cpuid,RTHAL_TIMER_IRQ);
00463 }
00464 
00465 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (rthal_pipeline_stage_t *ipd, int cpuid)
00466 
00467 {
00468     unsigned irq;
00469 
00470     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00471         {
00472         switch (irq)
00473             {
00474 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00475             case RTHAL_CRITICAL_IPI:
00476 
00477                 continue;
00478 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00479 
00480             default:
00481 
00482                 rthal_unlock_irq(ipd,irq);
00483             }
00484         }
00485 
00486     rthal_unlock_irq(ipd,RTHAL_TIMER_IRQ);
00487 }

00489 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */

00491 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00492 
00493 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long delay) {
00494     /* Even though some architectures may use a 64 bits delay here, we
00495        voluntarily limit to 32 bits, 4 billions ticks should be enough
00496        for now. Would a timer needs more, an extra call to the tick
00497        handler would simply occur after 4 billions ticks.  Since the
00498        timebase value is used to express CPU ticks on the PowerPC
00499        port, there is no need to rescale the delay value. */
00500     rthal_timer_program_shot(delay);
00501 }
00502 
00503 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00504     rthal_timer_release();
00505 }
00506 
00507 static inline int xnarch_send_timer_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t mask)
00508 
00509 {
00510 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00511     return -1;          /* FIXME */
00512 #else /* ! CONFIG_SMP */
00513     return 0;
00514 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00515 }

00517 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */

00519 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE

00521 #include <linux/init.h>
00522 #include <nucleus/asm/calibration.h>
00523 
00524 extern u_long nkschedlat;
00525 
00526 extern u_long nktimerlat;
00527 
00528 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00529 
00530 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00531 
00532 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00533 
00534 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00535 
00536 static int xnarch_trap_fault (unsigned event, unsigned domid, void *data)
00537 {
00538     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00539     fltinfo.exception = event;
00540     fltinfo.regs = (struct pt_regs *)data;
00541     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00542 }
00543 
00544 unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00545 
00546 {
00547 #if CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00548     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY) ?: 1;
00549 #else /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00550     /* Compute the time needed to program the decrementer in aperiodic
00551        mode. The return value is expressed in timebase ticks. */
00552     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_timer_calibrate()) ?: 1;
00553 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00554 }
00555 
00556 int xnarch_calibrate_sched (void)
00557 
00558 {
00559     nktimerlat = xnarch_calibrate_timer();
00560 
00561     if (!nktimerlat)
00562         return -ENODEV;
00563 
00564     nkschedlat = xnarch_ns_to_tsc(xnarch_get_sched_latency());
00565 
00566     return 0;
00567 }
00568 
00569 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00570 
00571 {
00572     int err;
00573 
00574 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00575     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00576        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00577     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00578 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00579 
00580     err = xnarch_calibrate_sched();
00581 
00582     if (err)
00583         return err;
00584 
00585     xnarch_escalation_virq = rthal_alloc_virq();
00586 
00587     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00588         return -ENOSYS;
00589 
00590     rthal_virtualize_irq(&rthal_domain,
00591                          xnarch_escalation_virq,
00592                          (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00593                          NULL,
00594                          IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00595 
00596     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_trap_catch(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00597 
00598 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE
00599     err = xnshadow_mount();
00600 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE */
00601 
00602     if (err)
00603         {
00604         rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00605         rthal_free_virq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00606         }
00607 
00608     return err;
00609 }
00610 
00611 static inline void xnarch_exit (void)
00612 
00613 {
00614 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE
00615     xnshadow_cleanup();
00616 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE */
00617     rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00618     rthal_free_virq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00619 }
00620 
00621 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
00622 
00623 #ifdef __cplusplus
00624 }
00625 #endif

00627 #else /* !__KERNEL__ */

00629 #include <nucleus/system.h>
00630 #include <bits/local_lim.h>
